executable.title: MANCOVA Shape Analysis Tool
executable.description: shapeAnalysisMANCOVA offers statistical shape analysis based on a parametric boundary description (SPHARM) as the point-based model computing method. The point-based models will be analyzed with the methods here proposed using multivariate analysis of covariance (MANCOVA). Here, the number of variates being tested is the dimensionality of our observations. Each point of these observations is a three dimensional displacement vector from the mean. The number of contrasts is the number of equations involved in the null-hypothesis. In order to encompass varying numbers of variates and contrasts, and to account for independent variables, a matrix computation is performed. This matrix represents the multidimensional aspects of the correlation significance and it can be transformed into a scalar measure by manipulation of its eigenvalues.
executable.contributor: Beatriz Paniagua, Marc Niethammer, Marc Macenko, Corentin Hamel

file.name: infile
file.label: Input File
file.description: File which contains all of the data to be analyzed. File is a list pointing to other data sources.

integer.name: infileColumn
integer.label: Input File Column
integer.description: Choose the column of the input file containing the testing surface. Index starting at 0.

parameters.label: Input Reading Parameters
parameters.description: Input paramters in order to read the input file

integer-vector.name: groupTypeColumns
integer-vector.label: Columns containing a Group Type
integer-vector.description: Columns containing a Group Type. Index is starting at 0.

integer.name: numIndependent
integer.label: Number of different independent variables.
integer.description: Number of different independent variables associated with each subject.

integer-vector.name: independentColumns
integer-vector.label: Columns containing independent variables
integer-vector.description: Columns containing independent variables. Index is starting at 0.

boolean.name: surfListScale
boolean.label: Scale all point data by the scale factor.
boolean.description: Scale all point data by scale factor found in the input file. This is typically used for correcting differences such as varying intercranial volumes (ICV).

integer.name: scaleColumn
integer.label: Column containing the scale factor
integer.description: Column containing the scale factor. Index is starting a 0.

integer.name: testColumn
integer.label: Column tested
integer.description: Which column of the data is being tested (0 based). If this is a standard "Group Test", it will be one of the group columns. If it is an "Interaction Test", it will be one of the independent variable columns.

boolean.name: KWMreadableInputFile
boolean.label: Input KWMeshVisu readable feature (vector) file.
boolean.description: Input data will be obtained from a KWMeshVisu readable feature (vector) file instead of the 3-d coordinates in a MeshFile.

double.name: significanceLevel
double.label: Cutoff of p-values considering significant.
double.description: What cutoff of p-values is considered significant. Only affects the FDR corrected results.

double.name: FDRdiscoveryLevel
double.label: Cutoff of p-values considering significant.
double.description: What cutoff of p-values is considered significant. Only affects the FDR corrected results.

boolean.name: writeZScores
boolean.label: out the z-scores.
boolean.description: Writes out the z-scores. Only uses group assignments from the first group column currently. z-score of group A is computed with mean and standard deviation from group B and vice versa. z-scores are output based on the projections on the mean surface normal as well as the corresponding Mahalanobis distances (where no projection is performed).

boolean.name: computeScaleFactorFromVolumes
boolean.label: Compute scale factor from volumes.
boolean.description: Reinterprets the scaling column values as volumes and compute the scaling factor from them. This first computes an overall average across all scaling factors and then computes the cubic root of the ratio of the original scaler to the average scale factor. This is considered standard practive if we scale with ICV volumes. WARNING: This is different from the traditional file format where these scaling were already pre-computed.

boolean.name: interactionTest
boolean.label: Test for statistically significant interaction.
boolean.description: Instead of a group test, simply test for statistically significant interaction of the data with a single independent variable.

boolean.name: simpleCorrs
boolean.label: Simple correlations (Spearman, Pearson).
boolean.description: Simple Spearman and Pearson correlations are computed, based on the normal to the average shape. This option is only valid in interaction test mode.

boolean.name: computeParametricP
boolean.label: Simple corr: Parametric p-value.
boolean.description: Computes the p-value parametrically for the simple correlation test.

boolean.name: useRoy
boolean.label: Roy statistics.
boolean.description: Uses Roy statistic for MANCOVA testing.

boolean.name: useWilks
boolean.label: Wilks statistics.
boolean.description: Uses Wilks statistic for MANCOVA testing.

boolean.name: useHotelling
boolean.label: Hotelling statistics.
boolean.description: Uses Hotelling statistic for MANCOVA testing.

boolean.name: usePillai
boolean.label: Pillai statistics.
boolean.description: Uses Pillai statistic for MANCOVA testing.

boolean.name: negativeCorrelation
boolean.label: Negative correlation.
boolean.description: For the simple (non-MANCOVA) correlation, test for negative correlation. (Only works in conjunction with parametric testing!)

boolean.name: positiveCorrelation
boolean.label: Positive correlation.
boolean.description: For the simple (non-MANCOVA) correlation, test for positive correlation.(Only works in conjunction with parametric testing!)

boolean.name: trendCorrelation
boolean.label: Trend correlation.
boolean.description: For the simple (non-MANCOVA) correlation, test for correlation.
